summary: This is an FBI intake document summarizing a phone call from a witness on July 2, 2020, reporting that Ghislaine Maxwell recruited her and other girls for Jeffrey Epstein in West Palm Beach, Florida, around 2000-2001. The witness describes being offered a job, performing tasks as a loyalty test, and being instructed to call teenage ballet dancers for Epstein. The witness states she is coming forward after seeing Maxwell deny recruiting girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the child sex trafficking case. The witness was recruited to work for him and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Reported to have recruited the witness and other girls for Jeffrey Epstein in West Palm Beach, FL, around 2000-2001. Instructed the witness on tasks and which girls to call.

persons.name: Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of having multiple pages dedicated to his telephone number in a phone book at Epstein's property.

persons.name: Ben Affleck
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of having his telephone number in a phone book at Epstein's property, with a joke from Maxwell about not stealing it.

connections.description: Maxwell is reported to have recruited girls for Epstein, and the witness worked for both of them.
Maxwell recruited and employed the witness, offering her a job for $100 per day to work for her and Epstein.
The witness worked for Epstein for about four months after being recruited by Maxwell.
Maxwell instructed the witness to call 14 or 15-year-old ballet dancers and recruit them, stating Epstein was a private client interested in ballet lessons.

events.title: Witness recruited by Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell approached the witness on a college campus and recruited her to work for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach.

events.title: Witness call to FBI NTOC
events.description: A witness called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report information about Ghislaine Maxwell recruiting girls for Jeffrey Epstein, prompted by Maxwell's arrest and her public denials.

keyFacts: A witness reported that Ghislaine Maxwell recruited her around 2000-2001 to work for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach, offering $100 per day.
The witness's first task was shredding a phone book, which she believed was a 'loyalty test'; the phone book contained multiple pages for Donald Trump's number and Ben Affleck's number.
Maxwell instructed the witness to call 14 or 15-year-old ballet dancers, telling them a 'private client in Palm Beach' was interested in ballet lessons.
The witness stated she did not come forward while Epstein was alive because he was a 'powerful man' but decided to report after seeing Maxwell deny recruiting girls.
The witness worked for Maxwell and Epstein for about four months, started using drugs during that time, and later went to an inpatient facility to get sober.
